it difficult to hear what anyone is saying so allowing that all great art
makes use of Multiplicity to some degree I still feel music is privileged in this
regard as it typically layers different kinds of events and we hear and listen
to and understand these simultaneities as part of musical
substance the main except ition to this situation occurs in religious music or
nationalistic music where the purpose is rather to create a sense of unity or even Conformity so that when at
Thanksgiving we sing We Gather together to ask the Lord's blessing or at a
political event we stand and Sing America the Beautiful we either sing the melody all together or we sing it in
harmony with all the parts moving together in rhythmic lock step what is called homophony in music but that is
not the most typical texture in classical or popular music which typically has multiple things going on
at the same time even in music which is largely Melody and accompaniment we can
separate out the accompaniment which typically provides a beat pattern from the melody which floats over the top and
this is certainly true in popular music where you hear you know the Rhythm Section is doing one thing and the lead
vocalist is doing something else and you hear how those things work together but it works just as well in a Mozart Sonata
where the alberty bass is going on and you have the melody over the
top and we hear differences in tamber that is um who is playing whether it's a
voice or a solo instrument and we hear the accompaniment on a keyboard or a guitar combined forces and these
differences in rhythm in tamber and in melodiousness create different textures
that we as listeners can separate or we can combine at our pleasure while we
